parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "job_name": "FULL",
    "output_file": "full-%j.out",
    "error_file": "full-%j.err",
    "nodes": 1,
    "tasks_per_node": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 4,
    "memory": "64G",
    "time": "10:00:00",
    "gpu": "1",
    "gpu_constraint": "Tesla",
    "partition": "gpu",
    "mail_type": "ALL",
    "mail_user": "nathan.nepper@student.ucouvain.be",
    "modules": [
      "Python/3.8.6-GCCcore-10.2.0",
      "root_numpy/4.8.0-foss-2020b-Python-3.8.6",
      "PyTorch/1.10.0-fosscuda-2020b",
      "matplotlib/3.3.3-foss-2020b",
      "SciPy-bundle/2020.11-fosscuda-2020b",
      "scikit-learn/0.23.2-fosscuda-2020b"
    ],
    "python_script": "$HOME/TSP-DeepRL-Thesis/train.py",
    "script_arguments": {
      "enc_num_heads": 8,
      "num_nodes": 20,
      "loss": "full",
      "directory": "$GLOBALSCRATCH/$SLURM_JOB_ID",
      "data_train": "$GLOBALSCRATCH/data/tsp20_train.txt",
      "data_test": "$GLOBALSCRATCH/data/tsp20_test.txt",
      "n_gpu": 1,
      "batch_size": 512,
      "epochs": 50,
      "teacher_forcing": 0.5
    }
  }
}
```

This script is running on the **SLURM** workload manager. It utilizes various software modules, including Python, root_numpy, PyTorch, matplotlib, SciPy-bundle, and scikit-learn. It also utilizes resources like GPUs (Tesla) and 64 GB of memory. The script also prepares results folders in the global scratch directory and the user's home directory. The script executes a Python script, `train.py`, located in the user's home directory, with various arguments for the training process.
